Dispose.summary: Releases unmanaged resources held by the object.

Dispose1.summary: Releases unmanaged resources held by the object.
Dispose1.param: Indicates whether the object is currently being finalized.

Equals.summary: Returns true if the given object is equal to this one, and false if not.

GetHashCode.summary: Gets a hash code for the object.

OpEquals.summary: Returns true if the two objects are equal, and false if not.

OpNotEquals.summary: Returns false if the two objects are equal, and true if not.

ToString.summary: Returns a human-readable description of the object.

TrimExcess.summary: Removes unused space within the object.

Do.exception: Thrown if the change has already been applied, or if the document has been altered such that the change cannot be applied.

Undo.exception: Thrown if the change has not been applied yet, or if the document has been altered such that the change cannot be applied.

OnNodeChanged.summary: Called when a node (or one of the node's descendants) that belongs to this document has changed such that it may need to be rerendered.

Children.summary: Gets an array containing the children of this region. Each child is a region that is contained within this region, both visually and document-wise.

LineCount.summary: Gets the number of lines within the node's content, without considering the effects of line wrapping.

CreateNew.summary: Returns a new of the same type as this, referencing the same , but with all other fields at their default.

GetNextSplitPiece.summary: Assists the work of line wrapping by calculating how many document indices from the content line can fit in amount of horizontal space of the layout line.
GetNextSplitPiece.param: The index of the current content line.
The previous piece returned from this method, or null if this is the first call for the given content line.
How much horizontal space is left in the current layout line, in pixels.
Whether the current layout line is empty.
GetNextSplitPiece.returns: Returns a representing the size and length of the content that can fit on the layout line.

Render.summary: Renders the span at the given point.

GetDescription.summary: Gets a short description of this node.
GetDescription.remarks: For instance, a root node may return "document" and a node that represents a picture may return "Picture: ALT" where ALT represents the picture's alt text. This text will be displayed in the description of change events.

OnNodeChanged.summary: Called when the node has changed substantially, such that it may need to be rerendered.

Parse.summary: Given a stream containing document data, converts it to a new and returns the new document.

Indexer.summary: Gets or sets the character at the given index.

Capacity.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters the buffer can hold. The capacity cannot be set lower than the current length.

Length.summary: Gets the number of characters in the text buffer.

CopyTo2.summary: Copies all of the text to the given array.
CopyTo2.param: The index within at which to write the text.

CopyTo3.summary: Writes text from the text buffer to the given .
CopyTo3.param: The text writer to which the text will be written.
The starting index of the text to write to .
The number of characters to write to .

CopyTo4.summary: Copies characters from the buffer to the given character array.
CopyTo4.param: The starting index of the text to copy to .
The number of characters to copy.

Delete.summary: Deletes the character at the given index.

Delete2.summary: Deletes deletes the specified number of characters starting at the given index.

FindNext.summary: Searches for the next occurence of the given character, starting from the given index.
FindNext.param: The index at which to begin the search.
FindNext.returns: Returns the index of the next occurence of the character, or -1 if it could not be found.

GetText.summary: Retrieves all of the text in the text buffer.

GetText2.summary: Returns a string containing the given number of characters, starting at the given index, from the text buffer.

InsertChar.summary: Inserts a character into text buffer at the given index.

InsertArray.summary: Inserts characters from a character array into the text buffer.

InsertString.summary: Inserts a string into the text buffer at the given index.

InsertReader.summary: Inserts all text from the given into the text buffer.

LineCount.summary: Gets the number of lines stored.

CharToLine.summary: Converts a character index to its line number.

CharToLine2.summary: Converts a character index to its line number and column.

GetLineInfo.summary: Given a line number, returns its character offset and its length.
GetLineInfo.param: Receives the character offset of the start of the line.
Receives the length of the line.

GetLineLength.summary: Returns the length of the given line.

GetLineLengths.summary: Returns an array containing the lengths of all lines.

AddLine.summary: Inserts a line at the end of the document with the given length.

AlterLength.summary: Alters the length of a line, given a difference in length.
AlterLength.param: The line number whose length will be altered.
The difference in length, such as 1 to increase the length by 1, or -1 to decrease it.

InsertLine.summary: Inserts a line at the given index, with the given length.

SetAllLengths.summary: Replaces all lines with the list of line lengths given.

SetLength.summary: Sets the length of a line to the given value.

GetOption.summary: Gets either the local or effective value of the given option.
GetOption.typeparam: The type of the option value.
GetOption.param: If true, the effective value will be returned. If false, the local value will be returned.

SetOption.summary: Sets or clears the local value of the given option.
SetOption.typeparam: The type of the option value.
SetOption.param: The value of the option. If null, the local value will be cleared, allowing values from ancestors to cascade to this style. If non-null, the local value will be set.
If true, will be called on the owner node.
